adjectives.description: accustomed (comparative more accustomed, superlative most accustomed)

entries.meaning: (of a person) Familiar with something through repeated experience; adapted to existing conditions.
examples: I am not accustomed to walking long distances
She is getting more and more accustomed to the cold

entries.meaning: (of a thing, condition, activity, etc.) Familiar through use; usual; customary.
examples: Who now shall lead thy scatter’d children forth,
There I got a place on the same terms as at Segovia, in a well accustomed shop, much frequented on account of the neighbourhood of the church of Santa Cruz, and the Prince’s theatre  […]

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of accustom
